title: 113_s2096
content: The Act may be cited as the "Freedom Through Energy Export Act" and references the Alaska Natural Gas Pipeline Act of 2004. Defines the Alaska Natural Gas Transportation Project. Section 102(2) (15 U.S.C. 720(2)) is amended to include projects authorized under the Alaska Natural Gas Transportation Act of 1976 and facilities for the export of Alaska natural gas. The curr_chunk is about Alaska natural gas and related facilities under the jurisdiction of the Commission. The curr_chunk discusses the issuance of a certificate of public convenience and necessity. Section 103 (15 U.S.C. 720a) is amended to include consideration and action on applications for authorization for a liquefied natural gas terminal and related facilities under the Natural Gas Act. In subsection (b), amendments are made to issue a certificate or authorization for an Alaska natural gas transportation project under the Natural Gas Act. Amendments are made to the Natural Gas Act to issue a certificate for a liquefied natural gas terminal and related facilities for the export of Alaska natural gas. Subsection (c) is revised to include projects under sections 3 and 7(c) of the Natural Gas Act. Subsection (g) now refers to the holder of a certificate. Amendments to the Natural Gas Act include environmental review requirements and the appointment of a federal coordinator. SEC. 5. FEDERAL COORDINATOR amends Section 106(c) to ensure Federal agencies are informed about the Alaska natural gas transportation project and any related issues. SEC. 6 clarifies ANGTA status and authorities. SEC. 6 clarifies the ANGTA status and authorities, allowing for the construction of necessary facilities for the transportation and export of natural gas from the Alaska North Slope. SEC. 7 amends Section 113 to replace "gas pipeline system" with "natural gas transportation project" and Section 115(1) to replace "pipeline" with "transportation project." SEC. 9 addresses loan guarantees. SEC. 9 amends Section 116(a)(1) to include a pipeline to the Alaska-Canada border for qualified infrastructure projects. SEC. 10 expedites approval for natural gas export to U.S. allies. The Natural Gas Act is amended to create an expedited application and approval process for natural gas exports to foreign countries with free trade agreements with the United States. The Natural Gas Act is amended to allow expedited approval for natural gas exports to certain foreign countries, including NATO member countries, Japan, and other countries deemed to promote US national security interests. Exportation of natural gas to Japan is considered in the public interest and will be granted without delay during the period of the Treaty of Mutual Cooperation and Security. The Treaty of Mutual Cooperation and Security between the United States and Japan, effective since 1960, remains in force. Amendments to the Natural Gas Act will apply to pending or new applications for natural gas exports to Japan and other designated countries to promote US national security interests.
